com.resourcemanager.controller

Class ResourceController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.resourcemanager.controller.ResourceController

  • @Controller
public class ResourceController
extends java.lang.Object
    This controller responds to the user input and uses the service layer to create, read, update or delete the Resource data model objects. This controller receives the input, optionally validates it and then passes the input to the model and directs the user back to a view to display the model and accept further user input.

      The resource service.

      The user service.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String addResource()
      Directs the user to the edit Resource view but with an id of 0 in order to create a new Resource only.
      java.lang.String deleteResource(java.lang.Long id)
      Deletes a particular Resource from the application cache and persistence layer, updating the associated Allocations, Skills and Projects.
      java.lang.String editResource(java.lang.Long id, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Passes the data model to the edit Resource view, and redirects the user to that view to respond to their input.
      java.lang.String listResources(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Retrieves all Resources from the persistence layer and passes them to the Resources view to display them to the user and respond to their input.
      java.lang.String saveResource(Resource resource, org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result)
      Takes the user input submitted via the edit Resource view and merges changes to the data model for the Resource and associated Allocations and Skills before passing that to the persistence layer.
      java.lang.String searchResources(org.springframework.ui.Model model, java.lang.String skillId, java.lang.String startDate, java.lang.String endDate, java.lang.String hours)
      Retrieves all Resources that match the search criteria of Skill, hours and no allocations during the specified time period from the persistence layer and passes them to the Resources view to display them to the user and respond to their input.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • searchResources

        @RequestMapping(value="/resources/search",
                method=GET)
public java.lang.String searchResources(org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                                                                                 @RequestParam(value="skillId")
                                                                                                                 java.lang.String skillId,
                                                                                                                 @RequestParam(value="startDate")
                                                                                                                 java.lang.String startDate,
                                                                                                                 @RequestParam(value="endDate")
                                                                                                                 java.lang.String endDate,
                                                                                                                 @RequestParam(value="hours")
                                                                                                                 java.lang.String hours)
        Retrieves all Resources that match the search criteria of Skill, hours and no allocations during the specified time period from the persistence layer and passes them to the Resources view to display them to the user and respond to their input.
        Parameters:
        model - the model
        skillId - the skill id
        startDate - the start date
        endDate - the end date
        hours - the hours
        Returns:
        the string
